alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 6:54AM CST until January 28 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Denham Springs affecting Livingston and East Baton Rouge Parishes. For the Amite And Comite Rivers...including Denham Springs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River at Denham Springs. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Flooding will begin in the westernmost parts of Denham Springs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM CST Saturday the stage was 28.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 29.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.3 feet on 01/22/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued this evening.late tonight at 100 AM CST.
